sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: U.S. President Joe Biden looks to repair diplomatic ties with oil-rich Saudi Arabia following a meeting with the Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Jeddah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: More than 16 civilians have died in Ukraine on Saturday as Russian forces have increased attacks on the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Large areas of Europe continue to tackle huge fires as temperatures soar to record levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Israel's army has carried out airstrikes on the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The attack was reportedly on the Hamas military site, according to Israeli officials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: U.S. President Joe Biden has met with Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for the very first time in a bid to reset relations between the two countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The top Democrat had previously promised to make the oil-rich kingdom an international pariah for its human rights record, but that was before Russia's invasion prompted a global energy crisis and rising inflation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: US officials say MBS ordered the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, an allegation the Crown Prince has denied. But Biden says he has warned the Saudi royal against any future attacks on dissidents. He basically said that he was not personally responsible for it. I indicated I thought he was. He said he was not personally responsible for it, and he took action against those who were responsible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And then I went on to talk more about how that dealing with any opposition to the criticism of the Saudi administration in other countries was viewed as, to me, a violation of human rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Among other issues, Biden announced international forces will withdraw from a strategically positioned island previously used to block Israel's access to the Red Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: International peacekeepers, including U.S. troops, will leave Tiran Island and the Red Sea, where they've been for over 40 years since the Camp David Accords.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Riyadh wants to turn the uninhabited islands into a luxury resort, but the deal still needs Israel's green light. While the Middle Eastern neighbors have no formal ties following the meeting, Saudi Arabia doubts that it is opening its airspace to Israeli airlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kramatorsk, a major city in Ukraine's Donbas region, is dealing with the aftermath of a

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: strike in its central square. While there are no casualties in this attack, it is one of a series of strikes across Ukraine, as Russian officials announced plans to step up their attacks on the country. On Saturday, strikes killed at least 16 civilians. Attacks by Russian forces hit areas in the north, the east and the south of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's second largest city, Kharkiv, is one of the places to see a severe bombardment in recent days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian forces also attacked a military base in Mykolaiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The attack killed more than 200 military personnel, according to the Russian Defense Ministry, and at least 13 pieces of military equipment were destroyed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Over the past days, Russian forces have been focusing on the Donbass region, which is making evacuation efforts in the region difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A volunteer described the situation on the ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Donbass, it's like every trip for us, it can be dangerous, because we didn't know when Russian rockets will come to this bus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: According to Ukraine's Interior Ministry, more than 17,000 strikes have been carried out on civilian targets since the start of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian opposition activist Andrei Pivovarov has been sentenced to four years behind bars for leading a banned pro-democracy group.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The former director of Open Russia

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: is the latest critic of President Vladimir Putin to be sent to prison, as Moscow continues its crackdown on independent media.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Speaking from his metal cage in court, the 40-year-old said change is coming for Russia sooner or later, and that progress cannot be stopped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Firefighters in Portugal are battling devastating blazes

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: as much of the country remains on wildfire alert.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Earlier, a plane tackling forest fires in the north crashed, killing its pilot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The government doesn't clean anything, he says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The private individual cleans more than they do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The trees sometimes even form a tunnel, one on top of the other.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It shouldn't exist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: How can the fire not pass from one side of the road to the other?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Of course it does.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The furnace engulfing swathes of southwest Europe is the second in weeks, with scientists blaming climate change and predicting more frequent and intense episodes of extreme weather.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In France, the situation is still tense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There have been 3,150 hectares burnt by fire, he says, but I must stress that the fire is

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: still not under control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's still not contained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is an extremely important point to underline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Spain, after three days of failed attempts, officials coordinating firefighting efforts said the situation had slightly improved on one of the fire fronts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And in western Romania, firefighters have extinguished more than 20 vegetation fires in the past three days, affecting almost 100 hectares of crops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Locals tried to tackle the blaze themselves, fearing it might reach their houses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Israel's army has released footage of strikes it carried out on the Gaza Strip. According to Israeli officials, the airstrikes, which took place early Saturday, were reportedly on a Hamas military site that housed materials to manufacture weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The attack reportedly also damaged nearby homes, but there were no casualties, according to Palestinian sources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The strike was also in response to rockets fired into parts of southern Israel from Gaza late Friday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: No Palestinian group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but Israel blames Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The group has ruled the Gaza Strip for 15 years, the same amount of time as Israel's blockade on the territory has been in place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: the same amount of time as Israel's blockade on the territory has been in place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The exchange took place hours after U.S. President Joe Biden left Israel after a three-day visit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: These mountains might never look the same again. According to one study, in the last 20 years, the greater Caucasus glaciers have lost 320 square kilometers of ice, while a number of small glaciers in the Caucasus have already disappeared.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: These changes are measured not only by scientists, but experienced by mountain climbers too, who frequently travel to high altitudes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Changes can already be felt by us. Seasons are changing too. Month months which were safe for mountain climbing are not anymore threat of avalanches and falling rocks are increasing

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I've seen melting glaciers myself for example get a glacier which used to be huge really just

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: looks miserable now it's heartbreaking to see it's hard to believe how much it has changed in hundred years if this, future will be grim.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Climate change is said to have played a role in the collapse of the glacier of the Marmolada mountain in Italy on July 3rd, which killed 11 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The collapse coincided with unusually high temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The incident raises the question of whether a tragedy like this could happen again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to the glaciologist Levan Tijelidze, author of several studies, glaciers in the Caucasus are shrinking in on every level, and some have receded by more than 4 kilometers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He said the number of glacial lakes are increasing too, which is also causing problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: These glaciers have shrunk by more than 1% every year, which means some glaciers might disappear in a couple of decades and not in 100 years, as was previously believed. Glaciers are important to the environment. They make up freshwater reserves and feed rivers. When glaciers melt, mountain sites can become unstable, triggering an avalanche.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Usually, it's only scientists who talk about the possible consequences of climate change, but the tragedy which unfolded in Italy shook people all over the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Scientists believe the problem needs to be addressed now or harsh consequences of climate change will be felt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dawid Kaganadze for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Japan Expo, the European Festival of Manga and Japanese Culture, is back in Paris after

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: two cancelled events in 2020 and 2021 because of the Covid-19 pandemic. And there's no lack of fans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I'm very happy to be here, she says. It's the first Japan Expo since Covid, since we were not allowed to be in the convention. We're really happy to be here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sumo is also there for the first time, represented by Paris Sumo, the only club in France dedicated to this traditional sport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We also really wanted to go behind the clichés about sumo, he says.
